info.game_comments:
Ask Alex #15: Sport.
Champion Update #3: Dan Melia.

(1, 1).clue: He cut a rug with Cameron Diaz in "The Mask"

(3, 1).clue: "Cow's breakfast" is a slang term for a big straw one of these worn by a farmer

(4, 1).clue: First course, fettuccine & shiitake these in a cream sauce with Madeira wine; then I have a surprise for you

(5, 1).clue: Where you sit at the doctor's office reading ancient magazines

(6, 1).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew hands us down a tale from the Lejre Archaeological Research Center, Denmark.) How stones of several tons were moved and lifted with Stone Age technology is the mystery of structures called dolmens, which were built as these

(1, 2).clue: Tina Fey said acting with Alec Baldwin is like this man dancing with a hatrack--he makes the hatrack look good

(3, 2).clue: In a timeworn phrase, something that may never take place won't happen "until the cows" do this

(4, 2).clue: I hope you give an "A" to my salad of these pungent leaves, also called rocket; it's a perfect side dish for you

(5, 2).clue: This feature lets you know someone else is trying to reach you on the phone while you're talking to another

(6, 2).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew reports with a modern European from the Lejre Archaeological Research Center, Denmark.) Drinking horns show the importance of booze in the Iron Age; until wine spread up from the south, the choices were beer and this honey-based drink

(1, 3).clue: He danced with cartoon mouse Jerry (as in Tom &) in "Anchors Aweigh", the film that established him as a superstar

(3, 3).clue: A flirtatious female is said to be "making" these cow parts "at you"

(4, 3).clue: What's in this 4-letter spread of pureed game, served in your hors d'oeuvre? That's my secret, isn't it?

(6, 3).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew chops up a fact for us at the Lejre Archaeological Research Center, Denmark.) The Stone Age is divided into three parts, depending on the sophistication of the tools; these antler axes tell us we're in this middle part

(1, 4).clue: She danced with the animated MC Skat Kat in the video to her 1990 no. 1 hit "Opposites Attract"

(3, 4).clue: Of all the world's countries, this one has the most cattle (appropriately, if you think about it...)

(4, 4).clue: This 2-word small, tender round of steak cut from the thick end of a beef tenderloin goes well with postman

(5, 4).clue: Drama in which Estragon & Vladimir idly pass time away hoping for the title character to appear

(6, 4).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew plants information in our minds from the Lejre Archaeological Research Center, Denmark.) The Lejre site has recreated a sacrificial bog like those from which many bodies have been recovered, luckily preserved by sphagnan, a component of this plant material

(1, 5).clue: A lowlight of this Brat Packer's career: singing & dancing with Snow White at the Academy Awards in 1989

(3, 5).clue: "The cattle are lowing" in this ever-popular Christmas carol

(4, 5).clue: Dessert! I'll have the ladyfingers, please, a small type of this "absorbent" cake; oh, you thought I meant...!

(5, 5).clue: Terry McMillan's bestselling 1992 novel about 4 African-American friends

(6, 5).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew hammers out a clue from the Lejre Archaeological Research Center, Denmark.) Because it's the Iron Age, the village has this, as in a Longfellow poem; it forged everything from axes to knives

(1, 1).clue: The origins of this Shakespeare tragedy go back to Ovid's tale of Pyramus & Thisbe

(2, 1).clue: This actor divorced Demi Moore in 2000; did she ask for the whole 9 yards?

(3, 1).clue: A thrave is 24 sheaves of this grain, whether spring, winter or durum

(4, 1).clue: Often compared to golf balls, this is the largest form of precipitation

(5, 1).clue: Dramatized by an HBO series, this Black Hills South Dakota hamlet boomed & waned with nearby gold mines

(6, 1).clue: Japanese for "exalted gate", it was a title once used for the emperor of Japan

(1, 2).clue: Shakespeare provided the first printed appearance of this word, from the Spanish for "lizard"

(2, 2).clue: He divorced Farrah Fawcett in 1982; did that make him the $3 Million Man?

(3, 2).clue: For dry measurements, it's one eighth of a peck; for liquid, it's .946 liters

(4, 2).clue: The cold phase of the weather-causing phenomenon El Niño is referred to as "La" this

(5, 2).clue: This southernmost Florida town, population 25,000, takes its name from Cayo Hueso, or "Bone Island" in Spanish

(1, 3).clue: It's the "earthy" Shakespearean term for the lower-class spectators

(2, 3).clue: "It's the Pitts" was one headline describing Brad's broken engagement with her in 1997

(3, 3).clue: In viscosity ratings, the "W" in 10W-40 means 10 is the winter grade rating of this liquid

(4, 3).clue: Monsoons prevail mainly in this ocean

(5, 3).clue: "We bathe the world" is the slogan of this West Central Arkansas town

(6, 3).clue: The easternmost island of the West Indies, its national flag is seen here

(1, 4).clue: Lysander uses the word "bedroom" while trying to convince Hermia to sleep close to him in this comic play

(2, 4).clue: Steven Spielberg divorced this actress in '89; was the courtroom a War of the Worlds? (Sorry, pun fatigue [I'm sure])

(3, 4).clue: In a surveyor's chain, it's a unit of length equal to 7.92 inches; on the web, it's an object connected via hypertext

(4, 4).clue: Meteorologist Theodore Fujita came up with the F-scale based on wind damage while studying these events

(5, 4).clue: On May 28, 1934 this fivesome was born in the hamlet of Callander, Ontario

(6, 4).clue: In 1988 Congress passed an Indoor Abatement Act to reduce levels of this toxic gas in the home

(1, 5).clue: "Men are April when they woo, December when they wed", explains Rosalind in this comedy

(2, 5).clue: In 1999 director James Cameron's marriage to this actress--dare we say--terminated?

(3, 5).clue: With regard to height, 3 hands equals 1 of these

(4, 5).clue: Some cyclones turn clockwise in the Southern Hemisphere due to this effect, which has no influence on toilet rotation

(5, 5).clue: Sherwood Anderson's collection of short stories about life in a small Ohio Town

(6, 5).clue: This handsome young man loved by Aphrodite was killed by a wild boar

(0, 0).clue: On Advertising Age's list of the Top 10 Ad Icons of the 20th c., they're the 2 alliterative entries that end in "Man"
